Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Minda G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern and charming. We thanks Nidhi for his kindness and pacience giving us good suggestions that enhanced the good times we had in this lovely city, like riding by bike in the Stanley Park, eating near the hotel at Davies Street, making shopping at Robson Street and so on. We are from Brazil and will surely recommend this place to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great property at a decent price downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: AntarcticNomad
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 3 nights in the Burrard in December 2011. Being from BC I was quite familiar with downtown hotels and have stayed in the Sheraton to the Coasts. When first getting to the Burrard, you may be dismayed by the lackluster exterior. However once you get inside it is a different story. With a modern look in the lobby you are greeted by very friendly and knowledgeable front desk agents. They seemed to take a genuine interest in why you are there. Check in was a breeze, so up to our rooms we went. Again walking to the rooms, there is an outside garden terrace, but not alot of action going on there. Still the exterior gives you a bit of a truck stop motel feeling. We enter the room. A large Queen bed, plush blankets and pillows and a large flat screen tv. There are plenty of pamphlets to tell you the amenities. Best of all there are free bicycle rentals. The bikes are in quite good condition (touring bikes, I believe it was 4 speeds), and they supply you with a helmet free of charge. Close enough to the bike trails along the sea walls etc. We enjoyed it so much we stayed 3 nights, when it was originally supposed to be one. With modern very comfortable rooms at less than $100/night with free bike rentals, the Burrard is a welcome surprise downtown Vancouver, and absolutely fantastic value. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: BeautyForAshes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 1 night on our way through Vancouver. We chose this hotel as it was the best hotel we could find that wouldn't cost us $200 and up for a night. We were pleasantly surprised upon arrival. The hotel was clean, well kept and our room was newly renovated and came with an espresso machine and free bottled water. The down side to being in downtown Vancouver is that it's noisy at night but that's to be expected. The hotel has a retro vibe that my husband and I loved and everything was done very tastefully. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for families with children or seniors, it's definitely for the younger crowd. The hotel also has some great perks such as cruiser bikes that you can sign out free of charge. Parking is $20 dollars a night and you have to park across the street at a secure parkade if they run out of space. We would stay here again if we were passing through Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, cool, clean, friendly,quiet!”
Reviews.Author: DJL73
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here and had a great time. One of the more reasonably priced hotels in the area, a really easy booking process. Check in was a breeze,staff were very friendly and helpfull throughout. The lift was being repaired during my stay but didn't matter because the porter carried my bags for me and my own legs can climb stairs! The retro decor was cool,made me happy to be in a funky environment. The location of the hotel is great,only moments away from all the downtown fun! I took advantage of the free cycles,even they were super cool! A great way to experience the sea wall and beautiful parks! A great breakfast can be found just round the corner on Davie street at Joes.A funky bar/restaurant would be a winner here!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with no elevator and terrible house keeping”
Reviews.Author: dtai010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place for 5 evenings, there are good and bads, and I will try to summarize them here for your reference. I visited Vancouver in March time, which is great, managed to catch some sunny days during this trip, which is a great experience by itself. When I arrived the hotel, the check-in process was ok, nothing particular. However, I later found out the elevator is not working (some building concent issues I later found out) so that you have to climb the stairs everyday. The room is great, stylish with nice capsule coffee supplied. Good size LCD TV, clean, nice bathroom, a bit small, but not uncomfortable at all. So this makes up for the bad experience I had from the elevator incident. However, the housekeeping is really terrible, which is what made my rating for this hotel is so low. During the entire duration of my stay, they did not replace my sheets nor re-supply my shower ammendies etc. It said they will change sheets every 2nd day, but for the whole time I stayed, they did not change it for me. As for ammendies, they did not replace them at all. So it's like no shampoo, no soap, not even tissue. I had to call everytime to get them, and it is always when you need it and you realized that they are not there, which made the experience really inconvenient. If not the poor housekeeping experience, I would give a 4 or 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Love this little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: birdiecece
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at The Burrard very last minute and was pleasantly surprised at what I arrived to find. This was a motel that has been recently renovated in a cool retro style and they did a great job. The location is great - close to Davie street, English Bay and a short walk to the center of downtown. The staff was immediately very friendly and helped to carry my bags to my room. There is an inner courtyard that is set up with lush plants and a cool sitting area that they encourage guests to use for hanging out. The room itself was very nicely decorated with clean modern decor and the most comfortable bed ever! Flat screen t.v, a little desk and a nice compact bathroom makes this place a great value. Unfortunately I didn't have time to take advantage of their free cruiser bikes that you can sign out - which is a great way to enjoy the seawall around downtown Vancouver. They also offer free passes to a gym nearby. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and have told all my friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “Here's one to recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah R
Reviews.Content: We were so thrilled to enjoy the many benefits of The Burrard. It's in a great location, has a wonderful, low key vibe, and the staff is great! It feels like a welcoming oasis in the midst of Vancouver! Debbie R.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + comfort”
Reviews.Author: Jeff J
Reviews.Content: Can't believe how lucky I was that a friend recommended I stay at The Burrard in Vancouver. The location is unbelievably great: walking distance to everything. Free parking; free phones; free Internet. But the two biggest attractions: a great value (even in Canadian $) and an extremely comfortable room (recently renovated). Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “a nice motel”
Reviews.Author: lizcarr78
Reviews.Content: Though the owners did a great job renovating the place, to me, it is still but a nice and modern MOTEL. We had a courtyard room and it had the familiar "motel feel" with the corridors and people passing by in front of your window, and car parking below. The superior queen room that promised more space was still small and the seating area mentioned on the website was but a chair and a small coffee table. That being said, the room and bathroom was very clean, and simply but nicely furnished. The bed was comfortable. The heating system was great, no noise and very effective. We did not interact much with the staff but they seemed nice. The location was great, in the middle of the city, easy to walk everywhere. Free wifi and phone greatly appreciated

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: visitorSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: The Burrard is a great hotel in downtown Vancouver. The price is very reasonable for a city like Vancouver. We had a beautiful stay. The room was new and clean with nice features, service was very friendly and efficient. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: Betty08Vancouver_BC
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at this Vancouver downtown hotel/motel in early March when attending the International Wine Festival. The rooms are rather small (as you would expect for a former motel), cinderblock affairs, painted white, with attractive, stylish touches - silver ottomans, clear plastic nesting tables, 50s retro-style lamps, and bright artwork. The beds are very comfortable (we had a 'queen +' room), with high-end bedding and plenty of pillows. By the way, we were glad for the extra pillows to jam over our heads starting at about 5:30 in the morning, when incredibly loud garbage pickup took place in the back alley - with that, the construction going on all around the hotel and the fact that you're close to the street traffic (the hotel is only 4 floors) be prepared for a noisy stay. The amenities were excellent, and included IPod/IPhone dock, 42 inch wall-mounted HDTV with premium channels Nespresso individual coffee maker, free bikes, and free, speedy Internet access. A few drawbacks - it was hard to find the premium channels on the TV as there was no guide, there was no cream for our coffee, and no bottled water in the mini-fridge - the cream and bottled water were both available in the lobby. There was also no elevator (it appears to have been permanently removed), so be prepared for a walk up a rather spartan stairwell! All in all this was a very pleasant stay and I would recommend The Burrard for people (especially younger people looking for a less expensive, somewhat self-consciously 'hip' choice in downtown Vancouver).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kozzy29
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing its so close to downtown.. The decor of the hotel is very retro which we loved! The staff was very helpful and can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CandaceShadley
Reviews.Content: I live in Whistler and have stayed in a number of different hotels in Vancouver. This one is fantastic. The staff were super friendly and helpful, the location was convenient, the value was exceptional, and everything was so new and clean. Best of all were the retro design and catchy elements throughout the property. Bikes to borrow, chic furniture, entertaining sayings in the rooms, free North American long distance, TVs loaded with movies, nespresso machines ... this'll definitely be the hotel I choose from now on.

Reviews.Title: “So retro, awesome staff, great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: drb_ATL
Reviews.Content: What's not to love? The Burrard is in a great location…tons of places to eat, drink and shop nearby. The staff is super friendly and very helpful. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the bed/pillows are so comfy. The courtyard is beautiful, but we couldn't take advantage of it due to weather at the time. The Burrard even has bikes that you can rent for FREE to take a spin around town. There is free wifi and even a Mac with internet access in the lobby so you can surf and print for free. Plus, there's free long distance…which was great since we were traveling from the US. The only downside is the street noise. The windows are incredibly insulating which helps, but Burrard St is quite busy 24/7. So, if you're a light sleeper, I'd recommend some earplugs…which I never travel without anyway. We like The Burrard so much that we stayed there at the beginning and the end of our 7 day ski trip to Whistler.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Retro”
Reviews.Author: Lostlineage
Reviews.Content: Pick this hotel last minute so we could go out for the evening Vancouver without the worry of driving or cabs! I must admit the price and the cool Website won me over! The room was exceptionally clean, the staff phonominal and location couldn't be beat! The retro decor was a nice twist with very cool signs and roof garden! Would I stay again or recommend to others? absolutely!

Reviews.Title: “good location, great design!”
Reviews.Author: barcelonautaOTT
Reviews.Content: The Burrard Hotel is located close at a walking distance from most of the places you'll be willing to explore in downtown Vancouver. The design is great in a very casual, comfortable and wise way. This is a particular hotel, do not expect big mirrors on the walls, flowered rugs and golden lamps... But, to be honest, thanks God! It's 50's inspired design it's only a wonderful way to accomodate today's traveler's necessities: spacious rooms at an affordable price (this is to say that they're not huge rooms, but they're bigger than the average non-grand-luxe hotel rooms), free wifi (we specially appreciated this after having to pay abusive prices to use wifi at 5* hotels!!), complimentary whater (idem as mentioned before; in 5* hey normally charge you between 3 and 5$ per bottle), and even a Nesspresso caffee machine with complimentary coffee capsules. There was also a computer in the hall that could be used for free and even prints were complimentary (we could print our boarding tickets, for example, in the easiest way). People in the reception were very friendly. Thank you and congratulations! The only down side is that the room was a bit noisy; Burrard Street is a pretty busy street and the hotel has only three or four floors, so all rooms are quite close to the street level. However, if you don't have a very light sleep or you're just staying a couple of nights, all the above-mentioned plus points make up for this... whenever we have the chance to go back to Vancouver, we will certainly stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Interior, Staff a bit odd...”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights recently. Disappointed to arrive and find the man on reception didn't speak English as a first language (very think accent) and he could barely understand me, I had to repeat myself three times. Then we find out that the elevator isn't working, it's not temporarily out of use, they haven't fixed it yet...but they don't advertise this like they should on their website. I am pregnant and cannot carry my 20kg bag up two flights of stairs!! Then the bag guy wanted a tip for taking my bag up...I don't think so! The room was modern and refurbished and looked amazing. It was however super hot in the room and no way to turn it down, middle of winter and we are sleeping on top of the bed because it's so hot. No ventilation in the bathroom so it turned into a Sauna everytime you used it. We did our part to save the environment and hung up our towels but housekeeping took them anyway every day regardless of us hanging them up. The guys loitering at the front desk were a bit odd and looked out of place...

Reviews.Title: “Surprise in the City”
Reviews.Author: CanadaSunshine58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Burrard recently and enjoyed it very much. What a pleasant surprise to see the beautiful courtyard once you get past the lobby. Palm trees! the suite was clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful. We asked if we could keep our car parked there after check out so we could do some shopping and it wasn't a problem at all. It would have cost us $ to park somewhere else so that was really helpful. Great location and definitely a place to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the heart of Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: ReviewMaster2000
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in Vancouver. From the outside might look dingy but... Once you get through the entrance this clean and very comfy place unveils. The staff was friendly. The hotel was recently remodel. The room were clean and quite spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly Staff. Nice Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ManOnTheMove
Reviews.Content: DO NOT let the exterior scare you! Once you enter the lobby, you will feel much better. Very simple place. All of what you need, and nothing of what you don't need. Brand new remodel of an old 50's motor inn. I had a King bed, up front, facing Burrard on the top (4th floor). Barely could notice any noise. I would suggest asking for the 4th floor. The 2nd floor is nice also because it is on the courtyard level. There are no rooms on the 1st floor, just a 7-11 and a Blenz Coffee House. The location is ideal. Practically on Davie & Burrard. The heart of this fine city. FREE calls to ALL of NORTH AMERICA, FREE bottled water, FREE bikes and FREE coffee from the in room Nespresso Machine! I have stayed at MANY hotels in this city, some far more glamorous than this one, but lacking personality. The Burrard is my choice when in Vancouver. Trust me, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME !”
Reviews.Author: Jason K
Reviews.Content: TOP NOTCH! CLEAN! FRIENDLY AND COOL ! VALUE ADDED? YES! Is it Law up there to be polite?? Must be. Staff you were great! No pool that is all I can find to gripe about. Would I stay again?? In A heartbeat !!!!!!!!!!!! 5 stars A + BRAVO !

Reviews.Title: “4 girls and a cat”
Reviews.Author: Yukonners
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Burrard for 4 nights this past December. 4 women and a cat I might add. Not only were we treated like royalty , so was the kitty. We arrived back to our room the first night to find a beautiful kitty bed, water bowl and a mat. we were impressed to say the least. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel any day. When ever we are in Vancouver , this is where we will stay ... CLEAN , Central , very helpful staff and felt like we were HOME !!! Thank so much 4 Yukon women and a cat : )

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: JayChicago2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 weeks in December and I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver. I switched from another hotel to here when I discovered all the freebies they offer - keurig style coffee machine in the room, refrigerator, free wifi, free phone calls all over North America (which saved me a lot as I am from US and my mobile carrier would have charged me an arm and a leg for all the calls I made), free bottled water. This is situated in a very good location and is near to restaurants, coffee shops and shopping. The front desk staff especially Mr Nidhi were fabulous and were very helpful in guiding me around the city and recommending good restaurants. The rates they offered me was unbeatable in that part of the city and for the amenities they offered. I had a great experience and if I am in Vancouver again I will definitely stay here. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: 1sds1
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly staff, and modern style. Free long distance calls, free use of their bicycles, free wifi, and good coffee in the rooms. We booked through Travelzoo, and the price of $89 included two small bottles of prosecco as a welcome drink. Fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Wow.... Fun & incredible value!”
Reviews.Author: Bex3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Burrard when our Vancouver home was rented to a TV commercial shoot. The rooms were so inexpensive that we let each of our 2 children invite a friend and got 3 rooms. It was soooooo comfy .... Great beds, linens, hi def TV with better picture than home. We walked a couple of blocks to see a movie & ate dinner nearby. No extras on our bill - we all used internet, my husband & I had expresso with milk (also gratis) in the room. We're gonna return for sure & get their cruiser bikes out in the spring!

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be querky”
Reviews.Author: biptutti
Reviews.Content: It's very modern and clean, trying a little hard to be a querky boutique but doesn't quite hit the mark. Good location in Vancouver, and it was a relief to have a coffee machine in the room. The garden would have been lovely it it wasn't for the bitter cold and drizzle!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: Arch123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the burrard and had a great experience. It was a unique hotel with lots of style the service was great and the rooms were amazing, they even included espresso machines. It is right downtown and closetl everything. I would definitely reccommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: Swimapp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Burrard in Vancouver and will return. This pace just underwent a major Reno And I consider this a little jewel surrounded by the big chain hotels. The service was outstanding, rooms were clean, comfortable and supplied with great amenities . Our parking was included along with free cruiser bikes to use during our stay. I loved the center courtyard that each room looks into with the tall palms growing up to the third floor room. Close to everything ..... I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and funky little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Snowisnotcool
Reviews.Content: I booked our 2 night stay at the Burrard based on trip advisor reviews and price. I was not disappointed with either! The hotel is in a borderline sketchy area, but not too scary, especially during the day. It is really an easy walk to all the places we like to visit in Vancouver like Tom Lee Music and the Pacific Center mall. It is an easy walk to the sky train stations in a couple of directions. The hotel is really clean, has comfy beds, nice tvs and great coffee makers. The front desk guys were super nice and friendly and helpful. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of city!”
Reviews.Author: Veronawelsh
Reviews.Content: The Burrard is a really cute remodeled hotel downtown. The rooms are amazing, there are free bikes to use to cruise around the city, espresso and mini fridges in the room. The hotel is modern with a classic feel. Excellent, friendly staff, great experience overall. We'll be back:)

Reviews.Title: “Trendy spot”
Reviews.Author: Kylegriffin
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Excellent coffee, nice rooms, cool courtyard, and friendly helpful staff. Will be staying there next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lauren D M
Reviews.Content: The room was small but cozy and stylish and clean. The bed was amazing. The courtyard was beautiful. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. The in room coffee was outstanding. Hip without being pretentious.

Reviews.Title: “Retro and chic”
Reviews.Author: iamjava
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in Sept for my gf's birthday. I bought the deal through Jaunt and it was definitely a good deal - it included 1 night stay at the King room, welcome drinks, free parking, free Wi-Fi, plus $50 giftcard for restaurant. Honestly when I bought the package, I looked at the Burrard's website and was not totally sure how we would like it. However we both really liked everything - newly painted and furnished room with a comfy King size bed, Nespresso machine (we since bought our own coz we liked it so much), retro looking bathroom. I believe you also got free local calls, free bottles of water, use of scooters etc.. And the location was perfect as we walked to Davie St for the free Denny's birthday breakfast. The front desk was very friendly. And we also enjoyed the garden in the middle of the building. All in all, great stay and we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Floss747
Reviews.Content: The Burrard Inn is an unexpected delight in Vancouver, close enough to the party scene, but not close enough to be disturbed at night. The staff are exceptional & extremely helpful, and the decor is outstanding. I cannot fault this hotel in anyway and the price is very reasonable. Well done to The Burrard Inn for great service, great comfort & great location!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: shiv a
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels you can find in Downtown Vancouver. Free water, free phone calls, new rooms, great staff and top class location. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: KristyBurnett
Reviews.Content: Three of of stayed at the Burrard Inn July 28 - August 2 2011. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. Our maid was freindly and happy. Little extras - free internet, free long distance and local calls, bottle water, use of bikes and helmets and a great front desk staff made our stay perfect. The location is perfect. Highly recommend this great little retro feel Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: scott h
Reviews.Content: Was in towen for the GranFondo - staff was awesome in helping with the bike and bike storage. Super convenient location and fun vibe. Cool 60'ish feel with all the modern updates. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy rooms in a good location but with one missing ingredient...”
Reviews.Author: SherpaP
Reviews.Content: Really good rooms recently refurbished with a chic design and have everything you need except one very important and missing switch on the wall - NO AIRCON !! If you visit in the summer months get ready to be broiled alive! If you survive this then everything else is great - friendly service free bike hire free gym pass nice courtyard coffee machine iPod docking radio very comfy beds - give it a try and join the campaign for air-con :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jamie B
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Vancouver for the Gran Fondo Whistler and stayed at the Burrard. Great location and central to all business and tourist attractions in the City. The hotel has a cool hipster vibe, and as a recently renovated 1960's era motor inn, captures all the elements of its original being with modern bathrooms, great comfortable beds and big flat screen TV's. The service was very friendly and very prompt. I would definately recommend staying at the Burrard.

Reviews.Title: “This newly remodeled hotel was FABULOUS!! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: sassystar
Reviews.Content: The Burrard Inn has new ownership and they have done a wonderful job updating the property!! The style is very hip and modern with a nostalgic twist on it. My husband found it online at the last min and so we were not sure what to expect. The staff are so kind and helpful and Michael did everything he could to make our stay perfect. The location is great, it is across the street from the hospital and they have FREE bike rentals on site!!! Vancouver has many bike trails and we spent most of our time exploring by bike. The Burrard doesn't just have normal bikes, but they have CRUISERS!! We were styling and everyone kept asking us where we got our hip bikes from!

Reviews.Title: “Smashed car window; great management”
Reviews.Author: ck76
Reviews.Content: Do not park in the lower level of The Burrard's controled-access parking garage. The upper level is visible from inside the hotel, so make sure to park there. The back window of my car was smashed. I learned later that this probably not all that common in the neighborhood because of all the local treatment centers. That being said, I could not have asked more of the management once this occurred. Dani and her team cleaned up the broken glass in my car, handled the police report, and even called the rental car company for me. They comped my room and if I traveled again to Vancouver, I would stay at The Burrard (though I would stick to taxis).

Reviews.Title: “Can't really recommend the place”
Reviews.Author: seanpadraig
Reviews.Content: It's a former motor inn. Recently redone and quite nicely, too. The place looks and is very clean and modern and up to date. A sort of retro-mod-hipster look. The bathrooms are obviously all brand new and, while small and lacking in counterspace, are adequate. The beds and linens are very nice and comfortable. The rooms are simply furnished, but tasteful and comfortable. I liked the location very well. Service was good. However, while it was a hot summer weekend, the room was just stifling. There's no fan in the bathrooms and no air conditioning or fan of any kind. The rooms all have a window on the courtyard and a window facing the outside of the building - so no breeze at all. I called the front desk and they brought me a box fan, saying it was the last one they had and that it had to be taken from housekeeping. Other guests complained about it while I was checking out and the man behind the desk explained that the new owners had done a lot of work and spent a lot of money on the place and that this was something they had yet to get to. Still, even a table fan in each room would help. Everyone was uncomfortable. Also note, this hotel charges easily twice what other hotels in the area charge for parking. And the rooms do not cost all that much less than some of the nicer hotels in the area. Overall, the place would do if there were no other options, but I wouldn't suggest it as a first choice.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasent Experience.”
Reviews.Author: duslbeck
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night and wished we could have stayed the whole week. Close to everything ,friendly and efficient Staff , good price and good value..

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: dei999
Reviews.Content: Not too close, not too far. About 15 minute walk to Canada Place, but with enough calm to sleep well at night. Rooms were clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Stylish and a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: allgoodinhwood
Reviews.Content: Came to Vancouver with a friend for a few days of sightseeing with just a few days notice. Looked at a number of hotels online (many of which were twice the price) and chose the Burrard Inn. We felt like we'd hit the jackpot when we arrived. From the exterior you can tell it was once a motor lodge, but they've done a fantastic job transforming the guest rooms into comfortable, modern spaces. EVERYTHING was refurbished and brand new from floor to ceiling. I wish my bathroom at home looked as great. It's a block away from Davie Street so if you're coming for the gayborhood -- you're within walking distance of everything. Great location, great value. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Just opened and wow what a Gem~!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trisha H
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we immediately felt that the hotel knew exactly who they were catering to and what kind of experience we were in for. Given that the hotel only just recently opened (after months of renos) we were pleasantly surprised by what they had done with this very unique space - given that it is surrounded by larger office like buildings. Catering to a hip, intelligent group that appreciates design as much as they appreciate value, The Burrard doesn't try to be everything to everyone. Rather, they've carved out their own niche in the city, giving their guests an immersive and unique experience. We were very impressed with all the touches and would gladly recommend this hotel to all of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel with sass and fun - will go back!”
Reviews.Author: SarahMarlayneRoberts
Reviews.Content: As a former Vancouverite, I remember the dodgy hotel that this WAS and what an improvement. Fun colour and a wink of humour in their signage and rooms, this is a cute little gem downtown. Comfortable bed and great amenities included - it's also a central location with a coffee shop on the main floor. This would be a great girls weekend hotel or spot for couples on a weekend in the city. I've stayed in similar hotels in other cities and it's a fun spot. There's no A/C though so if it's one of the 20 or so hot days in the city, your room will be toasty. I'm sure they'll be PACKED for Pride! The melrose place vibe is perfect for it, all it needs is a pool in the Courtyard!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mariamonk
Reviews.Content: If you want a good location, good service, super comfy space (with cable and wireless) and some awesome perks - stay here! you won't regret it - friendly staff, lots of great conveniences (printing, baggage storage, free bikes!!!, coffee and water), comfortable beds, very clean rooms, great soaps and shampoo - the new management clearly understand its clients and how to market a very fine place - I got a number of comments from strangers while biking about my great bike!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here just as they were finishing up renovations. Pretty much, there aren't so many frills. They have free internet, free coffee, and free bike rentals (though the bikes weren't so practical, but hopefully they'll improve this). The room was fine - very new so nice and clean, with a great TV. The staff was friendly - not that they were needed much. The location was right in Downtown Vancouver - near all the light rail and buses my heart could desire. Compared to other hotels in the area we priced, it seemed like a good deal. I'd happily stay there again. Also, your room entitles you to use of the gym down the block, which we did not check out.

Reviews.Title: “It was a fun and cute place!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBirds327
Reviews.Content: We spent about a week in the hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms very very clean. They were renovating the place, so they still had some construction going on some floors. You can get free umbrella and bicycle from the front desk! Free phone calls to anywhere in US and Canada! Free coffee and water... all for $130/night! Sounds expensive but, we really could find anything at this price in downtown area! Even the hostel was $50 per bed/person! You can get a place in North Vancouver, but you have to pay $9 every day per person to come to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel. Fumes still strong from remodels and it needs real blackout curtains.”
Reviews.Author: loftylofty
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel online. Love the new remodeled rooms, the location , free in-room expresso, coffee shop & 7-11 downstairs. Room is very clean and bed is very comfy. It's a bit noisy because of the downtown location but didnt really bother us. I didn't like the strong smell of the paint still present in the room, though. Oh and no a/c on a warm summer night wasn't good, and they need dimmers for the lamps.
